courseDetails.title: Excel Business Intelligence
courseDetails.shortDescription: La herramienta fundamental para el análisis de datos
courseDetails.longDescription:
Una herramienta fundamental y muy poderosa para el análisis de datos es Excel. Dentro de la serie de herramientas desarrolladas por Microsoft para este fin contamos con Power Query que nos permite limpiar, extraer y tranformar (ETL Extract, Transform and Load) desde la mayoría de los principales formatos de intercambio de datos como XML, CSV, Access, JSON y por supuesto de Excel. Power Query nos permite modificar, formatear, filtrar y realizar cálculos sencillos como sumarizar o acoplar los datos. Podemos realizar cambios en los formatos de los datos y, finalmente, exportar los datos a Excel o integrarlos a un modelo de datos. Una vez que hemos realizado nuestro proceso de ETL corresponde a crear el modelo de datos por medio de otra herramienta que es Power Pivot (también integrada a Excel), la cual también tiene funciones para extraer información para generar el modelo de datos, creando las relaciones entre las tablas y generando métricas sencillas como sumas, conteos, valores mínimos, máximos o promedios. Desde Powe Pivot podemos utilizar el poderoso lenguaje DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) el cual cuenta con funciones iterativas y de filtro con las que son muy complicadas en otros lenguajes. Los objetivos del presente curso son:

  • Aprender a limpiar, transformar e importar datos de diferentes formatos como Access, CSV, XML y Excel a un modelo de datos.

  • Aprender a instalar, importar datos, crear modelo de datos, cargar archivos externos, crear tablas dinámicas, crear gráficas dinámicas,  el área de cálculo.

  • Aprender a agregar datos al modelo, conocer la sintaxis de las expresiones de DAX, manejar los iteradores, crear una tabla de medidas, crear el fórmulas.

  • Aprender a utilizar las funciones All, Distinct, Values, AllNotBlak, Related y RelatedTable, comprenderá el contexto de fila y de filtro, la doble iteración.

El presente curso está enfocado a analistas de datos que manejen Excel que cuenten con conocimientos intermedios de Excel, una cuenta de Excel 365 y conocimientos general es en el manejo de datos. En todos los ejercicios contarás con los archivos correspondientes y los apuntes. También podrás poner a prueba tus conocimientos con los cuestionarios.
targetAudiences: Analistas de datos que manejen Excel

courseDetails.title: Language Learning with AI: Practical Skills Guide
courseDetails.shortDescription: Use ChatGPT and custom AI tools for vocabulary building, grammar practice, conversations, and personalized learning
courseDetails.longDescription:
Unlock a new approach to mastering any language with the power of artificial intelligence.
This course provides a practical, hands on framework for using AI tools to accelerate vocabulary growth, improve grammar, strengthen speaking confidence, and build consistent learning habits. Throughout the course, you will also gain access to a free context aware AI translator capable of working with virtually any known language, giving you an additional learning assistant you can use long after the course ends.


What this course offers

This program is designed to teach you how to use AI not as a gadget, but as a fully integrated learning companion. Each section focuses on real world scenarios and techniques that you can apply immediately.

You will learn how to:

  • Build vocabulary step by step with AI powered exercises

  • Reinforce grammar using AI generated explanations and targeted examples

  • Practice natural conversations and improve fluency through guided dialogue

  • Translate and analyze phrases with a context aware AI translator

  • Generate custom quizzes, tests, and learning plans automatically

  • Use AI for immersion through stories, dialogues, and topic breakdowns

  • Track progress, set goals, and design a self learning system supported by AI


Inside the course

Mastering LinguaTutor
A full walkthrough of LinguaTutor, a custom GPT designed as a personal language learning companion. You will explore its learning modes, including vocabulary translation, chat practice, explanations, test generation, and personalized recommendations. This module gives you a ready to use AI assistant for daily practice.

ChatGPT for Language Learning
A complete overview of how to use the ChatGPT web application for translations, grammar explanations, writing assistance, conversation practice, and content creation. You will also learn how to use prompts, instructions, and AI features to deepen immersion and build consistency.

Free AI Translator Included
During the course, you will receive access to a free AI translator developed specifically for context aware translation in nearly any language. It is engineered to support vocabulary learning, sentence analysis, and natural language examples.


Why this course works

The course focuses on practical methods backed by AI capabilities. Instead of memorizing isolated rules or words, you will use interactive tools that adapt to your level, goals, and learning style. This approach helps you stay motivated, progress faster, and retain more.


Who will benefit from this course

Whether you are a beginner starting from zero, an intermediate learner aiming to expand vocabulary, or an advanced speaker polishing your skills, this course provides a structured, efficient way to integrate AI into your routine.


Start learning smarter, faster, and with the support of powerful AI tools that guide you every step of the way.
targetAudiences: Learners who want to use AI to improve their language skills
Beginners looking for guided practice and structured learning modes
Intermediate and advanced learners seeking efficient daily exercises
Self learners who need conversational practice and personalized feedback

Do you believe happiness is something you chase, or something you choose?

This transformative personal development and self-improvement course, inspired by the empowering book Happiness Is Free, is designed to guide you on a journey of inner growth, emotional healing, and mindset transformation. Too often, we link happiness to external achievements, relationships, or possessions. But the truth is: happiness is an inside job. With the right tools, practices, and awareness, you can unlock the joy that has always been within you.

In this course, you’ll discover how to:

  • Let go of limiting beliefs and self-sabotaging habits.

  • Reframe life challenges into opportunities for growth, confidence, and resilience.

  • Cultivate gratitude, inner peace, and mindfulness in your daily life.

  • Build healthy routines that support emotional well-being, balance, and long-term happiness.

  • Strengthen your self-awareness, self-confidence, and sense of purpose.

  • Develop a positive mindset that empowers you to handle setbacks with courage.

This course combines practical lessons, reflective exercises, guided practices, and personal growth strategies to help you shift your perspective and create lasting happiness from within. Whether you are new to self-development or have been on your journey for years, you’ll gain fresh insights and powerful tools to transform your daily life.

Who is this course for?

  • Anyone seeking personal growth, self-discovery, and emotional freedom.

  • People who feel stuck, overwhelmed, or disconnected from joy.

  • Learners interested in building a resilient, positive mindset.

  • Anyone ready to live with more clarity, peace, and fulfillment.

By the end of this course, you’ll understand that happiness isn’t something you need to chase, buy, or wait for—it’s something you can create and choose every day. You’ll leave with a renewed sense of clarity, inner calm, and the confidence to design a life filled with meaning and joy.

You don’t have to wait for “someday” to be happy.
Happiness is free—and it begins with you, today.

While it complements the "AI Essentials" course, "Generative AI and Artificial Intelligence (AI) for Leaders" can be taken independently as it offers a comprehensive and tailored experience for leaders aiming to harness the potential of AI within their organizations.


Throughout the course, participants will delve into key topics such as AI-driven decision-making, fostering human-AI collaboration, data privacy and security, and integrating AI solutions with existing IT infrastructure. Using real-world examples and engaging discussions, leaders will gain a well-rounded understanding of the opportunities and challenges associated with AI implementation in the context of their roles.


The "Generative AI and Artificial Intelligence (AI) for Leaders" course is designed to equip participants with the knowledge and skills needed to successfully navigate the convergence of AI and organizational leadership. In today's fast-paced and competitive landscape, this course equips leaders with the tools they need to harness the power of AI, including the rapidly evolving field of Generative AI (GenAI), and apply these technologies at work. Through modules such as "Introduction to AI and Its Implications," "AI Applications and Use Cases," "Data and Governance," "Business and Strategic Considerations," "AI Ethics and Responsible Deployment," "Integrating AI with IT," and "AI and GenAI Demonstrations" leaders will be empowered to shape the future of their organizations and effectively navigate the AI-driven world. Starting in an academic environment, where he obtained his PhD in Engineering and an MBA at Universidade Nova de Lisboa, quickly evolved to C-suite positions in the corporate environment, both in large corporations and in start-ups.

With a passion for education, he also an invited Professor at Nova Information Management School, teaching Knowledge Management and Financial Analysis to graduate and undergraduate students.


Operations management (OM) is the administration of business practices to create the highest level of efficiency possible within an organization. It is concerned with converting materials and labor into goods and services as efficiently as possible to maximize the profit of an organization. OM covers all aspects of a business, from the design and management of products, services, and processes, to the management of supply chains and logistics.


Importance of Operations Management Skills for Career and Business:

Developing skills in operations management can significantly benefit your career and entrepreneurial endeavors in the following ways:

Career:

  • Enhanced Employability: Operations management skills are highly sought after in various industries, including manufacturing, healthcare, technology, retail, and service sectors. Expertise in OM can open up a wide range of career opportunities, such as operations manager, supply chain analyst, production planner, quality manager, project manager, and more.

  • Increased Earning Potential: Professionals with strong operations management skills often command higher salaries due to their ability to optimize processes, reduce costs, improve efficiency, and drive overall business success.

  • Problem-Solving and Decision-Making Abilities: Operations management equips you with the skills to analyze complex problems, identify bottlenecks, and make data-driven decisions that lead to improved operational performance. These skills are valuable assets for any career path.


Business management is the process of planning, organizing, directing, and controlling the resources (financial, human, and material) within an organization to achieve its goals and objectives effectively and efficiently. It encompasses a wide range of activities, from setting strategic direction and making operational decisions to managing resources and leading people.


Importance of Learning Linked Topics:

  • Business Models and Value Propositions: Understanding how businesses create, deliver, and capture value is crucial for identifying opportunities, developing new products or services, and ensuring long-term sustainability.

  • Strategic Management and Planning: This involves setting long-term goals, analyzing the competitive environment, and developing strategies to achieve success. Strong strategic thinking is essential for making informed decisions and guiding the organization towards its vision.

  • Organizational Behavior and Leadership: Effective leaders understand how to motivate and inspire teams, manage conflict, and create a positive work environment. Knowledge of organizational behavior is key to building high-performing teams and fostering a culture of innovation.

  • Risk Management and Business Continuity Planning: Businesses face a variety of risks, from financial and operational disruptions to natural disasters. Risk management involves identifying potential threats, assessing their impact, and implementing strategies to mitigate or avoid them. Business continuity planning ensures that critical operations can continue in the event of a disruption.

  • Change Management and Organizational Development: Organizations must continuously adapt to remain competitive. Change management skills are essential for leading and managing change initiatives effectively, while organizational development focuses on improving the overall performance and effectiveness of the organization.

  • Corporate Governance and Compliance: This involves ensuring that the organization operates ethically, transparently, and in accordance with relevant laws and regulations. Strong corporate governance practices build trust with stakeholders and protect the organization's reputation.


By developing a comprehensive understanding of business management and related topics, you'll gain the knowledge and skills necessary to build a successful career, make a positive impact, and contribute to the growth and development of your organization.
targetAudiences: No special requirements. A course for anyone who wants to build career in business

courseDetails.title: NumPy, SciPy, Matplotlib & Pandas A-Z: Machine Learning
courseDetails.shortDescription: NumPy | SciPy | Matplotlib | Pandas | Machine Learning | Data Science | Deep Learning | Pre-Machine Learning Analysis
courseDetails.longDescription:
Are you eager to dive into the core libraries that form the backbone of data manipulation, scientific computing, visualization, and machine learning in Python? Welcome to "NumPy, SciPy, Matplotlib & Pandas A-Z: Machine Learning," your comprehensive guide to mastering these essential libraries for data science and machine learning.


NumPy, SciPy, Matplotlib, and Pandas are the cornerstone libraries in Python for performing data analysis, scientific computing, and visualizing data. Whether you're a data enthusiast, aspiring data scientist, or machine learning practitioner, this course will equip you with the skills needed to harness the full potential of these libraries for your data-driven projects.


Key Learning Objectives:


  • Learn NumPy's fundamentals, including arrays, array operations, and broadcasting for efficient numerical computations.


  • Explore SciPy's capabilities for mathematics, statistics, optimization, and more, enhancing your scientific computing skills.


  • Master Pandas for data manipulation, data analysis, and transforming datasets to extract valuable insights.


  • Dive into Matplotlib to create stunning visualizations, including line plots, scatter plots, histograms, and more to effectively communicate data.


  • Understand how these libraries integrate with machine learning algorithms to preprocess, analyze, and visualize data for predictive modeling.

courseDetails.title: Le Changement Climatique : Causes, Conséquences et Solutions
courseDetails.shortDescription: Le changement climatique simplifié pour tous
courseDetails.longDescription:
Un cours rapide et informatif sur le sujet du changement climatique :


  • Dans ce cours, nous aborderons le phénomène du changement climatique sous plusieurs angles et nous discuterons de ses causes, de ses conséquences et de ses solutions.


  • Les gaz à effet de serre sont à l'origine de ce phénomène. Ces gaz, principalement le dioxyde de carbone, le méthane et l'oxyde nitreux, ont vu leur concentration augmenter ces dernières années dans l'atmosphère en raison de la combustion de combustibles fossiles, de l'agriculture et de l'élevage, ainsi que de la déforestation.


  • Ces gaz retiennent le rayonnement solaire et augmentent la température de la terre, ce qui entraîne un réchauffement de la planète et, à terme, un changement climatique.


  • Le changement climatique génère de nombreux effets indésirables à plusieurs niveaux, tels que l'intensification des phénomènes météorologiques extrêmes comme les inondations et les sécheresses, la fonte des calottes glaciaires et des glaciers, la propagation des maladies et des parasites, la destruction des habitats, le blanchiment des coraux, ainsi que de nombreux impacts sociaux et économiques.


Ce cours est donc composé de trois parties :


- Partie 1 : traite des causes directes du changement climatique, principalement l'énergie fossile, l'agriculture et la déforestation, et des causes indirectes telles que le capitalisme, le lobbying des entreprises, les crypto-monnaies et les négateurs de la science. Elle explique également l'origine des gaz à effet de serre et les concepts de réchauffement planétaire et de changement climatique.


- Partie 2 : détaille certaines des conséquences du changement climatique, telles que :


- les conditions météorologiques extrêmes et les catastrophes naturelles

- La fonte des glaces

- La propagation des maladies et des parasites

- La destruction de l'habitat et la disparition de la faune et de la flore

- La destruction des récifs coralliens

- Conséquences économiques et sociales


- Partie 3 : est consacrée aux solutions pour stopper le changement climatique, notamment aux niveaux gouvernemental et individuel, aux énergies renouvelables et à l'électrification des transports.


J'espère que vous apprécierez ce cours !
targetAudiences: Tous les apprenants peuvent bénéficier de ce cours

Product Management

Product Management is a multifaceted discipline that encompasses the planning, development, marketing, and optimization of a product or service throughout its lifecycle. It involves aligning customer needs with business goals and coordinating cross-functional teams to deliver successful and valuable products. Product managers act as the linchpin between various departments, ensuring seamless communication and collaboration.


Customer experience (CX) is the overall impression customers have of your brand throughout their interactions with your business. It encompasses everything from the initial marketing message to the post-purchase support they receive. Think of it as the customer journey, and CX is all the touchpoints along the way that shape their perception.


Key Areas of CX

  • Customer touchpoints: Every interaction a customer has with your brand, like websites, social media, advertising, in-store experience, and customer service.

  • Customer journey: Mapping out the steps a customer takes to interact with your brand, from awareness to purchase and beyond.

  • Customer satisfaction: How happy customers are with your product or service.

  • Customer loyalty: How likely customers are to return and recommend your brand to others.


CX Frameworks

Frameworks provide a structured approach to improving CX. Here are two common ones:

  • Customer Experience Journey Map: A visual representation of the customer journey, identifying touchpoints and opportunities for improvement.

  • Five Service Dimensions: A framework that focuses on five key aspects of service quality: reliability, responsiveness, assurance, empathy, and tangibles.


Why Learning CXM is Important for Companies:

  1. Improved Customer Satisfaction and Loyalty: CXM focuses on understanding and meeting customer needs, leading to increased satisfaction and a higher likelihood of repeat business.

  2. Enhanced Brand Reputation: Positive customer experiences contribute to a strong brand reputation, attracting new customers and retaining existing ones.

  3. Increased Revenue and Profitability: Satisfied customers are more likely to spend more, refer others, and remain loyal, all of which contribute to revenue growth.

  4. Competitive Advantage: In today's crowded marketplace, exceptional customer experience can be a key differentiator, setting a company apart from its competitors.

  5. Reduced Costs: Resolving customer issues proactively and efficiently can reduce the cost of customer service and support.


Why Learning CXM is Important for Building a Career as a Manager:

  1. In-demand Skill: CXM is a highly sought-after skill in today's business world, as companies increasingly recognize its importance.

  2. Career Advancement: Expertise in CXM can open doors to various managerial roles, such as Customer Experience Manager, Customer Success Manager, or Marketing Manager.

  3. Problem-solving Skills: CXM involves identifying and addressing customer pain points, which enhances problem-solving and analytical skills.

  4. Leadership Development: Managing customer experience initiatives requires strong leadership, communication, and collaboration skills.

  5. Cross-functional Collaboration: CXM often involves working with multiple departments, providing managers with exposure to different areas of the business.


Overall, learning CXM is crucial for companies looking to thrive in the modern business landscape. It's also a valuable investment for managers aiming to build a successful career in various industries.

What is Marketing?

  • Definition: Marketing is the process of identifying customer needs, creating products or services that fulfill those needs, and communicating the value of those offerings to potential customers.

  • Focus: Marketing focuses on getting the right message to the right audience, ultimately driving interest and sales.

  • Key Activities:

    • Market research

    • Product development

    • Brand building

    • Advertising and promotions

    • Content creation

    • Customer relationship management


What is Marketing Management?

  • Definition: Marketing management is the strategic and operational process of planning, organizing, implementing, and controlling an organization's marketing resources and activities.

  • Focus: Marketing management aims to create a cohesive marketing plan, optimize resource allocation, and measure the effectiveness of marketing initiatives.

  • Key Activities:

    • Developing marketing strategies and plans

    • Setting marketing budgets

    • Managing marketing teams

    • Overseeing marketing campaigns

    • Analyzing marketing performance (tracking metrics and ROI)

    • Making adjustments to strategies as needed


The Relationship Between Marketing and Marketing Management

Think of marketing as the actions you take to promote your business, and marketing management as the overarching system to plan, execute, and refine those actions strategically.

Business leadership is the art of guiding an organization towards success. It involves setting a clear vision, inspiring employees, and making strategic decisions that propel the company forward. Effective leaders create a positive work environment where people feel motivated and empowered to contribute their best.


Core Functions of a Business Leader:

  • Visionary: Business leaders paint a picture of the future – the company's goals and aspirations. They articulate a compelling vision that excites and unites the team.

  • Strategic Decision-Making: Leaders make tough calls, weighing risks and opportunities to navigate the business towards its goals.

  • Motivator and Coach: They inspire and empower employees, helping them grow and develop their skills.

  • Effective Communicator: Leaders clearly communicate the vision, plans, and expectations to everyone in the organization.

  • Team Builder: They foster collaboration and build strong, cohesive teams that work effectively together.


Why Leadership Skills Matter for Your Career:

Developing leadership skills is crucial for career advancement. Here's why:

  • Increased Visibility: Leaders stand out. They take initiative, solve problems, and get things done, which grabs the attention of superiors.

  • Promotion Potential: Companies are always looking for strong leaders to fill management positions.

  • Stronger Teams: If you can lead and motivate others, you'll be a valuable asset on any team, making you a desirable candidate for projects and assignments.

  • Adaptability and Change: The business world is constantly evolving. Strong leadership skills equip you to adapt to change and navigate challenges.

courseDetails.longDescription:
Master the art of Google Advanced Search and unlock powerful techniques to find accurate, hidden, and highly relevant information faster than ever before. In today’s fast-paced digital world, basic Google searches are no longer enough. Most people only know simple searches, but professionals, researchers, and marketers use advanced search operators to save time and uncover valuable data.

In this course, you’ll learn how to use Google’s most powerful operators like inurl:, intitle:, filetype:, site:, cache:, before:, and after: to perform smarter, faster, and more efficient searches. We’ll explore real-world examples showing you how to locate specific documents, PDFs, industry reports, government data, guest posting opportunities, and recent brand mentions in just a few clicks.

This course is designed for students, researchers, digital marketers, content creators, journalists, cybersecurity enthusiasts, and anyone who wants to search smarter and work more productively. With step-by-step lessons and practical demonstrations, you’ll gain the confidence to apply these techniques in your academic work, business research, competitor analysis, and online investigations.

By the end of this course, you’ll have the skills to filter unwanted results, save valuable time, and access high-quality, verified information like a pro. You’ll no longer waste hours scrolling through irrelevant results — instead, you’ll master advanced techniques that give you complete control over your searches.

Take the next step, sharpen your research skills, and start mastering Google Advanced Search Techniques today!

Curso de Redes (com fio) para Hackers do Bem

Entenda o Funcionamento das Redes Cabeadas na Visão da Segurança Ofensiva


Você já tentou entender como as redes cabeadas funcionam, mas encontrou apenas explicações técnicas que não conectam teoria com segurança da informação? Sente que falta algo para realmente compreender como os dados trafegam fisicamente e como essa infraestrutura pode ser explorada ou protegida?

Este curso foi criado para você que quer construir uma base sólida sobre o funcionamento de redes com fio e sua relação direta com a segurança da informação. Aqui você vai estudar os fundamentos das redes cabeadas de forma clara e objetiva, entendendo como essas estruturas operam e por que elas são essenciais para quem quer trabalhar como Hacker do Bem.

Começamos explorando o conceito fundamental de rede, estabelecendo as bases necessárias para todo o conhecimento que vem depois. Você vai entender o que realmente é uma rede de computadores e como ela se organiza para permitir a comunicação entre dispositivos. Essa compreensão inicial é fundamental para que tudo o que vem depois faça sentido.

Em seguida, mergulhamos nas diferentes formas de classificar redes. Você vai aprender a categorizar redes por escopo, entendendo as diferenças entre LAN, MAN e WAN. Depois, exploramos a classificação por meio de transmissão, focando especificamente nas redes cabeadas e suas características. Avançamos para a classificação por topologia, onde você descobrirá como os dispositivos podem ser fisicamente organizados e quais implicações isso traz para a segurança. Por fim, estudamos a classificação por arquitetura, diferenciando modelos cliente-servidor, peer-to-peer e outras estruturas fundamentais.

A partir daí, o curso aprofunda no funcionamento prático das redes. Você vai estudar a parte física, focando no switch como dispositivo central da comunicação em redes locais. Depois, exploramos a parte lógica, detalhando os protocolos de enlace que fazem a mágica acontecer na camada 2 do modelo de redes. Em seguida, apresentamos uma visão geral dos servidores de rede, mostrando como eles organizam e distribuem recursos em um ambiente corporativo.

O curso então ganha um foco especial na perspectiva da segurança ofensiva. Você vai estudar como as redes são atacadas, explorando as principais ameaças que ocorrem na camada 2 - aquela que muitos profissionais negligenciam, mas que é fundamental para a segurança. Depois, você descobrirá como as redes são protegidas, aprendendo técnicas de hardening que todo administrador de redes deveria implementar e que todo Hacker do Bem precisa conhecer para avaliar a segurança de uma infraestrutura.

Este é um curso introdutório que estabelece os fundamentos necessários para quem está começando sua jornada em segurança de redes ou precisa solidificar conceitos sobre infraestrutura física que nunca ficaram realmente claros. Não espere demonstrações de ataques reais ou laboratórios complexos de exploração. O objetivo aqui é garantir que você entenda como as redes cabeadas funcionam de forma aplicada, sabendo onde localizar as vulnerabilidades quando estiver pronto para avançar em seus estudos como Hacker do Bem. Informe-se sobre nossos outros cursos que complementam perfeitamente este conhecimento.

Ao concluir este curso, você terá uma visão clara de como as redes cabeadas são organizadas e operam, saberá identificar os principais pontos de vulnerabilidade na camada 2 e terá construído a base conceitual necessária para aprofundar seus conhecimentos em segurança ofensiva de redes.


LISTA DE LIÇÕES

1. Introdução

2. O que é uma rede?

3. Classificando a Rede: por Escopo

4. Classificando a Rede: por Meio de Transmissão

5. Classificando a Rede: por Topologia

6. Classificando a Rede: por Arquitetura

7. Funcionamento da Rede: Parte Física (o Switch)

8. Funcionamento da Rede: Parte Lógica (Protocolos de Enlace)

9. Visão Geral dos Servidores de Rede

10. Como as Redes são Atacadas? (Ameaças na Camada 2)

11. Como as Redes são Protegidas? (Hardening)

12. Encerramento

Não fique só na teoria: no final do curso, você encontrará uma ferramenta online criada especialmente para você praticar e avaliar seus conhecimentos. Aproveite.
targetAudiences: Hackers do Bem e estudantes de TI que precisam entender o funcionamento das redes cabeadas e sua infraestrutura física para identificar vulnerabilidades e falhas de segurança na camada de enlace.

courseDetails.title: Secure Code in Java and Spring Boot: Build Resilient Apps
courseDetails.shortDescription: Learn to write secure, robust Java and Spring Boot code by applying real-world security best practices and patterns
courseDetails.longDescription:
Secure Code in Java and Spring Boot is the ultimate guide for developers who want to write production-ready, secure applications using industry-standard tools and best practices. Security is no longer optional - it's a critical part of every developer's skill set. This course gives you the deep, practical knowledge you need to write code that defends itself.

You’ll learn how to protect your Java and Spring Boot applications from the most dangerous vulnerabilities: SQL injection, XSS, CSRF, insecure deserialization, misconfigured authentication, broken access control, and more. You'll go far beyond theory—each topic is backed by hands-on examples and real-world scenarios.

What makes this course different?

This course is designed by Andrii Piatakha, a best-selling instructor on Udemy with over 1,000,000 students worldwide. Andrii is known for his unique and proven methodology that perfectly blends clear theoretical explanations with deep practical exercises. His teaching style helps students internalize complex security concepts through action, not just memorization.

You won’t just learn how to avoid insecure code - you’ll learn how to write secure, efficient, and maintainable Java and Spring Boot applications that are ready for production and compliant with modern security standards like OWASP Top 10.

You will learn how to:

  • Implement strong authentication and role-based access control with Spring Security

  • Protect APIs with JWT, OAuth2, and secure token handling

  • Prevent SQL injection using JPA, Hibernate, and parameterized queries

  • Avoid Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) and Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)

  • Use encryption and hashing (e.g. AES, bcrypt) the right way

  • Secure microservices communication and configuration

  • Validate and sanitize user input effectively

  • Handle secure file uploads and prevent injection attacks

  • Store credentials and secrets safely

  • Apply Secure Development Lifecycle (SDLC) practices

  • Use automated tools to detect vulnerabilities in your code and dependencies

Who is this course for?

Whether you're a backend developer, tech lead, software engineer, or DevSecOps professional - if you’re working with Java and Spring Boot, this course is for you. You’ll gain immediately applicable skills to level up your security posture and reduce risk in your applications.

By the end of this course, you'll not only understand how to prevent the most critical security issues in Java and Spring Boot - you’ll also be confident in building secure applications from day one.

Join over 1 million developers who’ve already leveled up with Andrii Piatakha’s courses. Start writing secure code today.

Spring Boot developers looking to enhance application security
Backend engineers responsible for API protection
Software engineers working on enterprise Java applications
Developers preparing for security-focused roles
Teams adopting secure development lifecycle practices
Tech leads enforcing coding standards and security guidelines

QA engineers testing for security vulnerabilities
Anyone aiming to prevent common security issues in Java and Spring Boot projects

Operations management (OM) is the administration of business practices to create the highest level of efficiency possible within an organization. It is concerned with converting materials and labor into goods and services as efficiently as possible to maximize the profit of an organization. OM covers all aspects of a business, from the design and management of products, services, and processes, to the management of supply chains and logistics.


Importance of Operations Management Skills for Career and Business:

Developing skills in operations management can significantly benefit your career and entrepreneurial endeavors in the following ways:

Career:

  • Enhanced Employability: Operations management skills are highly sought after in various industries, including manufacturing, healthcare, technology, retail, and service sectors. Expertise in OM can open up a wide range of career opportunities, such as operations manager, supply chain analyst, production planner, quality manager, project manager, and more.

  • Increased Earning Potential: Professionals with strong operations management skills often command higher salaries due to their ability to optimize processes, reduce costs, improve efficiency, and drive overall business success.

  • Problem-Solving and Decision-Making Abilities: Operations management equips you with the skills to analyze complex problems, identify bottlenecks, and make data-driven decisions that lead to improved operational performance. These skills are valuable assets for any career path.


Digital Transformation. In business landscape, digital transformation has become a critical strategic imperative for companies across all industries. This program aims to provide participants with a deep understanding of digital technologies, their impact on businesses, and effective strategies for leveraging them to drive growth and innovation.


Importance of Education in Digital Transformation for Companies and Managers:

In the  business environment, digital transformation has emerged as a key driver of competitive advantage and long-term success. Embracing digital technologies is no longer an option but a necessity for companies to remain relevant and thrive. However, implementing digital transformation initiatives requires more than just adopting new tools; it demands a comprehensive understanding of digital trends, customer behavior, data analytics, and organizational change management. This education helps companies and managers:


Strategic Adaptation: Digital transformation education empowers organizations to align their strategies with the opportunities and challenges presented by the digital age. It helps leaders identify potential areas for disruption and develop agile responses to stay ahead of the competition.


Enhanced Customer Experience: Understanding digital transformation enables businesses to design and deliver exceptional customer experiences, which are crucial for customer retention and loyalty in today's customer-centric market.


Data-Driven Decision Making: The course equips managers with skills in data analysis and interpretation, enabling them to make data-driven decisions that lead to improved business outcomes.


Innovation and Creativity: Participants will learn about emerging technologies and innovation processes, fostering a culture of creativity within their organizations and driving continuous improvement.


Organizational Resilience: With digital transformation education, managers can build resilient organizations capable of adapting to disruptions and thriving in times of uncertainty.


Importance of Digital Transformation Education for Building a Career:

In the competitive job market, professionals with expertise in digital transformation are in high demand across various industries. Building a career with a strong foundation in digital transformation can open up numerous opportunities for individuals:


Competitive Advantage: Having a recognized qualification in digital transformation sets job seekers apart from others in the job market, giving them a competitive edge when applying for leadership positions.


Career Progression: As companies prioritize digital transformation to remain competitive, they seek managers and leaders with expertise in this area. Earning an executive diploma in digital transformation can lead to career advancement and promotion.


Versatility: Digital transformation knowledge is valuable across industries, allowing professionals to explore diverse career paths and contribute to different sectors.


High-impact Roles: Graduates can secure roles that involve leading digital transformation initiatives, making strategic decisions, and driving organizational change, thereby playing a crucial role in shaping their company's future.

courseDetails.title: How to build a business case: Certification
courseDetails.shortDescription: The step by step guide to building and delivering highly effective business case proposals, approved first time!
courseDetails.longDescription:
Delivering a well thought through business case is crucial if you are going to have any chance of having that case approved. On too many occasions people submit subpar business cases which are either too long, too short, too complex or too vague. Creating a business case that strikes the right balance is a fine art, and this course will show you the steps you need to follow to do just that.

In this course, you will learn:

- How to pull together an effective business case.

- The key process steps you need to complete.

- Key things to look out for when creating your case.

- Hints and tips on how to increase your chances of approval.

This course is about delivering concise, to the point and effective business cases that attract and keep the readers attention, tell a story and include the right amount of detail. The method followed in this course has been tried and tested by myself, your instructor, plus many other people in business, on numerous occasions, all with the outcome of having the business case in question approved.

In the past year I have submitted 30 business cases in my current organisation, and ALL have been approved first time due to the fact that they have followed this model. These business cases have ranged from small improvement projects to large, transformation projects requiring new hiring, new software installations and structural organisational change. The model works for any size of project!
targetAudiences: Anyone currently working for a company who wants to build highly effective business cases
Anyone who owns a business / manages a department and wants to deliver business cases that get approval, first time
Anyone who wants to upskill in this field as developing and delivering business cases is a skill HIGHLY in demand
Anyone who wants to leave the course with full confidence in delivering business cases

courseDetails.longDescription:
Welcome to program: GIT, GitLab, GitHub Fundamentals for Software Developers

GIT, GitLab, GitHub Fundamentals for Software Developers, Basics of work, Command Line & GUI, Intro to GIT for Beginners


Course provided by MTF Institute of Management, Technology and Finance

MTF is the global educational and research institute with HQ at Lisbon, Portugal, focused on business & professional hybrid (on-campus and online) education at areas: Business & Administration, Science & Technology, Banking & Finance.

MTF R&D center focused on research activities at areas: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Data Science, Big Data, WEB3, Blockchain, Cryptocurrency & Digital Assets, Metaverses, Digital Transformation, Fintech, Electronic Commerce, Internet of Things.

MTF is the official partner of: IBM, Intel, Microsoft, member of the Portuguese Chamber of Commerce and Industry.

MTF is present in 210 countries and has been chosen by more than 520 000 students.


Importance of Git Skills for Software Developers and Effective Software Development at Enterprise Companies

Mastering Git, particularly in conjunction with platforms like GitLab and GitHub, is crucial for software developers and the overall success of software development within enterprise companies. Let's break down the significance of each skill set you mentioned:


  • Version Control: Git allows developers to track changes to code over time, creating a history of modifications. This enables easy backtracking to previous versions if errors occur or features need to be rolled back.

  • Collaboration: Git facilitates seamless collaboration among multiple developers working on the same codebase. Developers can work on different features concurrently, merge their changes, and resolve conflicts in a controlled manner.

  • Code Safety: Git acts as a safety net, allowing developers to experiment without fear of irreparably damaging the codebase. Branches and commits provide isolation for new features or bug fixes.


  • Command Line Proficiency: Understanding Git commands empowers developers to execute precise actions and troubleshoot issues effectively.

  • GUI Fluency: Graphical interfaces like those in GitLab and GitHub simplify common Git operations, making it more accessible for beginners and streamlining workflows.

  • Platform Compatibility: Familiarity with both GitLab and GitHub ensures adaptability across different development environments and collaborative projects.


  • Foundation for Growth: This introductory knowledge lays the groundwork for further exploration of Git's capabilities and advanced features.

  • Confidence Building: Mastering the basics empowers developers to contribute to projects and collaborate effectively, boosting confidence and engagement.

  • Industry Standard: Git is a ubiquitous tool in software development. Proficiency is essential for career advancement and employability.


Benefits for Enterprise Software Development

  • Enhanced Collaboration: Git facilitates effective communication and coordination among large teams, promoting efficient development and reducing bottlenecks.

  • Improved Code Quality: Version control, code reviews, and branching strategies contribute to higher code quality and fewer bugs.

  • Accelerated Development: Git's features, such as branching and merging, enable parallel development and faster release cycles.

  • Streamlined Onboarding: New developers can quickly get up to speed by accessing the project's Git repository and understanding its history.

  • Reduced Risk: Git's safety net and version control minimize the risk of code loss or corruption, protecting valuable intellectual property.


Git proficiency is indispensable for modern software developers and plays a vital role in driving successful software development at enterprise companies. Investing in Git training and fostering a culture of collaboration around Git practices yields significant benefits in terms of productivity, code quality, and overall project success.
targetAudiences: No special requirements. Course for any, who want to build a career at Software Development or improve their knowledge.

courseDetails.title: Process Mapping: Toolkit
courseDetails.shortDescription: The step by step guide to deploying these highly effective process mapping tools to great effect within your business
courseDetails.longDescription:
Mapping and improving your organisation's processes is something that is becoming increasingly important. As we move forward, organisations are building more and more processes, all with varying purposes, touching various departments and delivering various products. As these become more complex and organisations grow, having the knowledge of how to map, analyse and improve these processes is a skill becoming vital. If you can deliver such improvements to your organisation's processes today, they will reward this favourably!

In this course, you will learn the fundamental building blocks behind the task of mapping, analysing and improving your processes. We will cover:

- What is Lean Six Sigma?

- What are the concepts of process maps and process mapping?

- Swim Lane maps.

- SIPOC maps.

- Value Streams maps.

- Time Value maps.

- Value Add Charts.

- Spaghetti Diagrams.

We will approach these by understanding what the tool is, how to deploy the tool and then give a LIVE demonstration of the tool in action. This will ensure you grasp the need for the tool well enough to be able to deploy it effectively within your organisation / projects.

At the end of this course, you should have the confidence not only to conduct wide ranging process improvement projects but also to sell the vision and importance of process improvement to leaders within your organisation.
targetAudiences: Anyone currently working for a company who wants to map out their processes
Anyone who owns a business / manages a department and wants to improve operational performance
Anyone who wants to upskill in this field as improving your business from within is a skill HIGHLY in demand
Anyone who wants to leave the course with full confidence in delivering these tools

courseDetails.title: Introducción a Bootstrap 5
courseDetails.shortDescription: Una forma rápida y profesional de hacer páginas responsivas
courseDetails.longDescription:
Bootstrap 5 es sin duda el framework más utilizado para hacer páginas web responsivas de manera rápida y profesional en el mundo, pero no solo nos permite adaptar nuestras páginas web a cualquier dispositivo, sino que nos brinda una enorme gama de herramientas para simplificarnos la vida de diseñadores y desarrolladores web. 

Este curso está enfocado para personas que no tengan ningún conocimiento sobre el tema, hasta poder lograr páginas flexibles y poderosas. Es necesario que se tengan conocimientos básicos sobre HTML y CSS, pero no necesitas ser un experto en el área. No necesitas tener ningún conocimiento en JavaScript, ya que no utilizaremos este lenguaje.

Al final el curso podrás:

  • Comprender los inicios de Bootstrap 5, cómo instalarlo en la computadora o desde un CDN, usar básicamente la cuadrícula para hacer una página responsiva.

  • Aprender las diferencias de tipografía y de estilo entre HTML y Bootstrap 5 en etiquetas como abbr, mark, pre, kdb o blockquote.

  • Aprender a crear listas agrupadas, paneles y grupos de paneles, menús dropdown, listas colapsables, crear un acordeón, menú de tabuladores, menú de píldoras, menús verticales, así como tabuladores y píldoras centradas en Bootstrap.

  • Crear barras de navegación normales y en colores invertidos, añadir un dropdown, crear opciones a la derecha e izquierda de la barra, agregar botones, un formulario y hacer una barra colapsable para un dispositivo pequeño.

  • Aprender a crear y modificar los objetos media, centrando verticalmente, justificarlo a la izquierda o derecha o anidarlos.

  • Crear un carrusel de imágenes y posteriormente agregará subtítulos, creará ventanas modales, añadirá un tooltip a un elemento HTML, creará ventanas popover, así como una barra ScrollSpy y un componente Affix.

  • Crear páginas responsivas de varias columna para dispositivos pequeños, medianos, computadoras de escritorio y de pantalla ancha. Conocerá el uso de las clases hidden, visible, clearfix, offset, pull y push.

En el curso encontrarás los apuntes a cada sección, así como más de 100 ejercicios que te ayudarán a lograr nuestros objetivos. Para este curso necesitas una computadora con Internet y un navegador moderno, así como un editor de código como SublimeText, Brackets, Dreamweaver, etc.
targetAudiences: Desarrolladores y diseñadores de páginas web con conocimientos básicos de HTML y CSS.

courseDetails.title: The Doughnut Economics
courseDetails.shortDescription: A Visual Framework For Sustainable Development
courseDetails.longDescription:
The Doughnut Economics Framework has become one of the most influential models in sustainability, reshaping how governments, institutions, and innovators define progress. It goes beyond traditional economics to answer the most urgent question of our century: How can humanity thrive without breaking the ecological limits of our planet?


What Makes This Course Essential?

Most discussions on sustainability focus on isolated problems such as climate change, poverty, inequality, and pollution.
The Doughnut Framework brings all these pieces together into one clear, visual, and actionable model.


By taking this course, you will learn:


  • Where humanity stands right now in terms of social shortfall and ecological overshoot

  • How global conditions have shifted through the 21st century

  • Why current progress is off-track, and what must change

  • How inequalities between rich and poor countries shape our shared future

  • How the Doughnut redefines progress beyond GDP and endless growth

  • How does the Doughnut model compare to the SDGs


By the end of this course, you will not only understand where humanity stands today, but also what it will take for societies to thrive within planetary boundaries. You will be equipped with a framework that challenges old assumptions and opens the door to a smarter, fairer, and more sustainable world.


Enroll now and take the first step toward understanding one of the most influential ideas shaping the future of economics, sustainability, and global development.
targetAudiences: Decision-makers, engineers, scholars, activists, practitioners and anyone curious about the Doughnut Framework

courseDetails.title: Free Google Maps API Course for Beginners
courseDetails.shortDescription: Learn Google Maps API basics for web developers – free beginner course with markers, shapes & events.
courseDetails.longDescription:
Unlock the power of Google Maps API and bring interactive maps to your web projects! This free beginner course is designed for developers, hobbyists, and students who want to learn how to integrate Google Maps into websites and applications. You’ll start from the basics and gradually explore key features like markers, shapes, events, and advanced enhancements.


What you’ll learn:

  • How to set up Google Maps in your projects and configure basic controls.

  • How to add and customize markers, InfoWindows, and advanced marker animations.

  • How to draw and style shapes like circles, polygons, polylines, and rectangles.

  • How to handle map events and user interactions, including clicks, zoom changes, and boundary shifts.

  • How to manage multiple markers efficiently with clustering techniques.

Course Modules:

Module 1 – Map Basics
Learn how to initialize a Google Map, configure zoom and pan controls, and add your first marker with an InfoWindow.

Module 2 – Drawing Shapes
Draw circles, polygons, polylines, and rectangles, and learn how to customize their appearance to highlight areas or paths.

Module 3 – Map Events & Interactions
Make your maps interactive by responding to user actions like clicks, zoom changes, and bounds changes.

Module 4 – Advanced Markers & Clustering
Customize markers with icons and animations, and use clustering to manage multiple markers efficiently.

Module 5 – Full Course Preview
Get a sneak peek of advanced features such as autocomplete, directions, and routing, and see how the full course can take your skills to the next level.


Who this course is for:

  • Beginners and web developers who want to learn Google Maps API from scratch.

  • Students and hobbyists interested in interactive maps and location-based applications.

  • Anyone wanting a practical, hands-on introduction to map visualization and interactivity.

Requirements:

  • Basic knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

  • A Google account to access the Google Maps API key (free).

  • No prior experience with Google Maps API is needed.

Start building interactive maps today with this free, beginner-friendly Google Maps API course and take the first step toward mastering location-based web applications!
targetAudiences: Beginner developers who want to start integrating Google Maps into their web projects.
Students and hobbyists curious about interactive maps and location-based applications.
Web developers looking to explore the Google Maps API before enrolling in the full advanced course.
Anyone interested in learning map visualization and basic interactivity in a practical, hands-on way.
